page.title: 13 Strawberries cont...
page.content:
The railway was originally used to transport the strawberries from this area to the markets.Many tons past through the railway each day.The strawberries had to be packed by small ,young boys so they could fit between the stacks of boxes.
The punnets used to be made out of wicker with wooden tomatoe boxes for carrying.Now they are put in plastic punnets with cardboard trays.Most strawberries were taken through Botley as opposed to Fareham. Fareham refused to handle strawberries because there would be so many horses and carts, creating traffic jams and big turds outside the station.
